ðŸŒŸ hellpaper | C
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Wallpaper selection and application on Linux systems.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Multiple Layouts (Grid, Horizontal River, Vertical River, Wave) â€¢ Live Search â€¢ Full-Screen Preview â€¢ GPU-Accelerated Effects â€¢ Total Customization via .conf file
ðŸ“– Summary: Hellpaper is a wallpaper picker for Linux that offers multiple animated layouts, live search, and full-screen preview capabilities. It allows users to easily select and apply wallpapers with GPU-accelerated effects and complete customization through a configuration file.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ prompt-optimizer | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Optimizing prompts for large language models to improve the quality and accuracy of AI-generated content.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Intelligent prompt optimization with multi-round iterative improvement â€¢ Dual-mode optimization for system and user prompts â€¢ Real-time A/B testing for comparing original and optimized prompts
ðŸ“– Summary: Prompt Optimizer is a tool designed to help users write better AI prompts, leading to improved AI output quality. It offers features such as intelligent optimization, A/B testing, multi-model integration, and multi-platform support. The tool can be used as a web application, desktop application, Chrome extension, or via Docker deployment.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ gallery-dl | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Downloading image galleries and collections from various online sources for offline access and archival purposes.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Downloads image galleries and collections from various image hosting sites. â€¢ Cross-platform compatibility. â€¢ Configurable options. â€¢ Powerful filenaming capabilities. â€¢ Supports HLS/DASH video downloads via yt-dlp/youtube-dl.
ðŸ“– Summary: gallery-dl is a command-line tool designed for downloading image galleries and collections from numerous image hosting websites. It offers cross-platform support, extensive configuration options, and powerful filenaming features. The tool can be installed via various package managers and also provides standalone executable versions.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ voltagent | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Building and orchestrating AI agents for chatbots, virtual assistants, automated workflows, and complex multi-agent systems.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Core Engine for defining individual agents â€¢ Multi-Agent Systems orchestration â€¢ Workflow Engine for multi-step automations
ðŸ“– Summary: VoltAgent is an open-source TypeScript framework designed to simplify the development of AI agent applications. It provides modular building blocks, standardized patterns, and abstractions for creating chatbots, virtual assistants, and automated workflows. The framework supports multi-agent systems, workflow orchestration, tool integrations, data retrieval, memory, and is compatible with popular LLMs.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ KDiskMark | C++
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: HDD and SSD benchmarking on Linux systems.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Configurable block size, queues, and threads count for each test â€¢ Many languages support â€¢ Report generation
ðŸ“– Summary: KDiskMark is a user-friendly, open-source disk benchmarking tool for Linux. It provides a graphical interface to run benchmarks on HDDs and SSDs, leveraging Flexible I/O Tester (fio) for the actual testing. The tool allows users to configure test parameters and generates comprehensive, easy-to-interpret reports.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ REFramework | C++
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Modding, scripting, and adding VR support to RE Engine games.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Lua Scripting API & Plugin System â€¢ Generic 6DOF VR support â€¢ First Person mod â€¢ Free Camera â€¢ Scene Timescale
ðŸ“– Summary: REFramework is a modding framework and scripting platform for RE Engine games, enabling users to create and install mods, add VR support, and implement custom scripts. It provides a Lua scripting API, VR support, and various in-game tools for developers and modders to enhance and modify the supported games.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ BotCommander | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Managing and monitoring multiple Python bots through a web interface.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Web interface for managing Python bots â€¢ Automatic startup of bots â€¢ CPU, memory, and uptime monitoring â€¢ Bot management (start, stop, restart, disable) â€¢ System information display
ðŸ“– Summary: BotCommander provides a web interface for managing multiple Python bots, each running in its own isolated environment. It allows users to monitor CPU/RAM usage, uptime, and control bot processes (start, stop, restart, disable). The system also displays overall system information.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source
